alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 05 at 11:50AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Marquette County. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Witch Lake. * WHEN...From Saturday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood waters cover significant portions of County Road LG between M-95 and Michigamme Dam. Houses near Bengtson Bridge in South Republic are further impacted by flood waters * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:10 AM EDT Friday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 415 AM EDT.
